parameters.text:
=Look at my audio transcript from my spanish class and generate flashcards for me to study. 
You are a helpful assistant that helps me create "words" flashcards from this transcript. Please create flashcards in the following format: 

- Spanish word or phrase 
- English translation 
- Meaning or usage in a sentence

-------

Make sure you understand the context of the transcript to create relevant flashcards. 
Example:
lista could mean "list" in English, but in the context of "estar lista" it means "to be ready". So you need to understand the context to create accurate flashcards.

------

Example transcript:
" Mi hermana se llama Sarah y yo, Luis. Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. A Sarah le gusta leer libros y a mí me gusta jugar al fútbol. "

Flashcards:
1. Spanish: hermana
   English: sister
   Usage: Mi hermana se llama Sarah. (My sister's name is Sarah.)

2. Spanish: vivir
   English: to live
   Usage: Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. (We live in a big house.)

----------------------------------

Transcript:

 {{ $json.transcript }}

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant that helps create flashcards for studying Spanish vocabulary based on audio transcripts.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.text:
=Look at my Spanish class notes from Notion. Notion was able to transcribe my spanish learning class and help me summarize it for me. You are a helpful assistant that helps me create "words" flashcards from my notes. Please create flashcards in the following format:

- Spanish word or phrase 
- English translation 
- Meaning or usage in a sentence

-------

Make sure you understand the context of the notes to create relevant flashcards. 
Example:
lista could mean "list" in English, but in the context of "estar lista" it means "to be ready". So you need to understand the context to create accurate flashcards.
Make sure to only use spanish words or phrases that are in the notes provided.

------

Example notes:
" Mi hermana se llama Sarah y yo, Luis. Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. A Sarah le gusta leer libros y a mí me gusta jugar al fútbol. "

Flashcards:
1. Spanish: hermana
   English: sister
   Usage: Mi hermana se llama Sarah. (My sister's name is Sarah.)

2. Spanish: vivir
   English: to live
   Usage: Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. (We live in a big house.)

----------------------------------

Notes:
{{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant that helps create flashcards for studying Spanish vocabulary based on Notion Notes

value.text: ={{ $json.count_spanish }} New words have been added. Check them out at https://spanish-word-buddy.vercel.app/

parameters.text:
=Look at my audio transcript from my spanish class and generate flashcards for me to study. 
You are a helpful assistant that helps me create "words" flashcards from this transcript. Please create flashcards in the following format: 

- Spanish word or phrase 
- English translation 
- Meaning or usage in a sentence

-------

Make sure you understand the context of the transcript to create relevant flashcards. 
Example:
lista could mean "list" in English, but in the context of "estar lista" it means "to be ready". So you need to understand the context to create accurate flashcards.

------

Example transcript:
" Mi hermana se llama Sarah y yo, Luis. Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. A Sarah le gusta leer libros y a mí me gusta jugar al fútbol. "

Flashcards:
1. Spanish: hermana
   English: sister
   Usage: Mi hermana se llama Sarah. (My sister's name is Sarah.)

2. Spanish: vivir
   English: to live
   Usage: Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. (We live in a big house.)

----------------------------------

Transcript:

 {{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant that helps create flashcards for studying Spanish vocabulary based on audio transcripts.

parameters.content:
## Upload Transcript
** Copy paste the transcript you already have

## Upload Notion pdf
** Mostly used by Ana

parameters.text:
=We have a list of Spanish words and phrases with their English translations and usage examples. 
It contains columns like: 
spanish: actual spanish word/phrase, 
english: definition of the spanish word/phrase, 
usage: usage of the spanish word in a sentence, 


Clean and optimize this list automatically:

1. Remove duplicates
- Treat duplicates as same Spanish term after normalization (trim spaces, lowercase, ignore accents, ignore punctuation like ¿ ? ! . ,).
- If duplicates exist, keep the best row using these rules:
    - Prefer rows with longer/more complete usage
    - Set known = TRUE if any duplicate has known = TRUE
    - Set learned to the sum of duplicates’ learned values

2. Remove very common words
Remove entries whose Spanish term (after normalization) matches any of these (including accentless versions):
hola, gracias, adios, por favor, buenos dias, buenas noches, lo siento, salud, de nada, si, no, amigo, amiga, familia, comida, agua, casa, escuela, trabajo, dinero, tiempo, día/dia, noche, hombre, mujer, niño, niña, perro, gato

3. Keep English translations in usage
- Do NOT remove parenthetical English translations from the usage field.

4. Add learning structure
Create these new columns:
- group (category) using keyword-based grouping based on spanish/english/usage (examples: Greetings & Politeness, Time & Dates, Work & Study, People & Family, Travel & Places, Feelings & Opinions, Goals & Motivation, General/Other)

- difficulty_score (number) using a transparent heuristic (longer phrases, more words, grammar connectors like que/de/por/para/aunque/porque, accents, punctuation like ¿¡ increase score)

- difficulty bucketed into Easy / Medium / Hard using score percentiles (bottom 33% Easy, middle 33% Medium, top 33% Hard)

-------------

Input: 

{{ JSON.stringify($json.output) }}

--------------

output:
[
    {
        "spanish": "",
        "english": "",
        "usage": "",
        "group": "",
        "difficulty_score": "",
        "difficulty": ""
    }
]

main.node: Append or update row in sheet

output.usage: Diversión es como 'fun'. (Fun is 'diversión'.)
Me pareció divertido. (It seemed fun to me.)
Estuve trabajando en un proyecto personal. (I was working on a personal project.)
Estoy trabajando en un proyecto personal. (I'm working on a personal project.)
Voy a mostrarte mi portafolio al final de la llamada. (I'll show you my portfolio at the end of the call.)
También estoy actualizando mi currículum. (I'm also updating my résumé.)
Aún no te lo mostré. (I haven't shown it to you yet.)
Necesito tu ayuda. (I need your help.)
¿Estás tomando un cóctel? (Are you having a cocktail?)
Tenemos una nueva decoración. (We have a new decoration.)
Lo compré en una tienda online. (I bought it in an online store.)
¿Dónde lo compraste? (Where did you buy it?)
¿Dónde lo conseguiste? (Where did you get it?)
Mándame una foto al final. (Send me a photo at the end.)
Sí, son como flores. (Yes, they are like flowers.)

output.english: a lot of light / too much light
output.usage: Hay demasiada luz. (There is too much light.)
Te lo mostraré al final de la llamada. (I'll show it to you at the end of the call.)
Nos quedamos en casa porque llovió mucho. (We stayed at home because it rained a lot.)
El año pasado llovió mucho. (Last year it rained a lot.)
No salí porque estaba enferma. (I didn't go out because I was sick.)
En clase estudiamos los infinitivos: hacer, cocinar, salir. (In class we studied the infinitives: to do, to cook, to go out.)
Hacer y cocinar son infinitivos. (To do and to cook are infinitives.)
Mi hermana cocinó todo ella sola. (My sister cooked everything by herself.)
El año pasado no pude salir. (Last year I couldn't go out.)
¿Cómo está el clima en Toronto estos días? (How is the weather in Toronto these days?)
Hace poquito frío, pero es mejor que la semana pasada. (It's a little cold, but it's better than last week.)
Eso es una vela. (That is a candle.)
Pon el vaso en la mesa. (Put the glass on the table.)
Comimos frambuesas. (We ate raspberries.)
Panamá es muy bonito. (Panama is very beautiful.)

parameters.text:
=Look at my audio transcript from my spanish class and generate flashcards for me to study. 
You are a helpful assistant that helps me create "words" flashcards from this transcript. Please create flashcards in the following format: 

- Spanish word or phrase 
- English translation 
- Meaning or usage in a sentence

-------

Make sure you understand the context of the transcript to create relevant flashcards. 
Example:
lista could mean "list" in English, but in the context of "estar lista" it means "to be ready". So you need to understand the context to create accurate flashcards.

------

Example transcript:
" Mi hermana se llama Sarah y yo, Luis. Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. A Sarah le gusta leer libros y a mí me gusta jugar al fútbol. "

Flashcards:
1. Spanish: hermana
   English: sister
   Usage: Mi hermana se llama Sarah. (My sister's name is Sarah.)

2. Spanish: vivir
   English: to live
   Usage: Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. (We live in a big house.)

----------------------------------

Transcript:

 {{ $json.transcript }}

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant that helps create flashcards for studying Spanish vocabulary based on audio transcripts.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.text:
=Look at my Spanish class notes from Notion. Notion was able to transcribe my spanish learning class and help me summarize it for me. You are a helpful assistant that helps me create "words" flashcards from my notes. Please create flashcards in the following format:

- Spanish word or phrase 
- English translation 
- Meaning or usage in a sentence

-------

Make sure you understand the context of the notes to create relevant flashcards. 
Example:
lista could mean "list" in English, but in the context of "estar lista" it means "to be ready". So you need to understand the context to create accurate flashcards.
Make sure to only use spanish words or phrases that are in the notes provided.

------

Example notes:
" Mi hermana se llama Sarah y yo, Luis. Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. A Sarah le gusta leer libros y a mí me gusta jugar al fútbol. "

Flashcards:
1. Spanish: hermana
   English: sister
   Usage: Mi hermana se llama Sarah. (My sister's name is Sarah.)

2. Spanish: vivir
   English: to live
   Usage: Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. (We live in a big house.)

----------------------------------

Notes:
{{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant that helps create flashcards for studying Spanish vocabulary based on Notion Notes

value.text: ={{ $json.count_spanish }} New words have been added. Check them out at https://spanish-word-buddy.vercel.app/

parameters.text:
=Look at my audio transcript from my spanish class and generate flashcards for me to study. 
You are a helpful assistant that helps me create "words" flashcards from this transcript. Please create flashcards in the following format: 

- Spanish word or phrase 
- English translation 
- Meaning or usage in a sentence

-------

Make sure you understand the context of the transcript to create relevant flashcards. 
Example:
lista could mean "list" in English, but in the context of "estar lista" it means "to be ready". So you need to understand the context to create accurate flashcards.

------

Example transcript:
" Mi hermana se llama Sarah y yo, Luis. Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. A Sarah le gusta leer libros y a mí me gusta jugar al fútbol. "

Flashcards:
1. Spanish: hermana
   English: sister
   Usage: Mi hermana se llama Sarah. (My sister's name is Sarah.)

2. Spanish: vivir
   English: to live
   Usage: Nosotros vivimos en una casa grande. (We live in a big house.)

----------------------------------

Transcript:

 {{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful assistant that helps create flashcards for studying Spanish vocabulary based on audio transcripts.

parameters.content:
## Upload Transcript
** Copy paste the transcript you already have

## Upload Notion pdf
** Mostly used by Ana

parameters.text:
=We have a list of Spanish words and phrases with their English translations and usage examples. 
It contains columns like: 
spanish: actual spanish word/phrase, 
english: definition of the spanish word/phrase, 
usage: usage of the spanish word in a sentence, 


Clean and optimize this list automatically:

1. Remove duplicates
- Treat duplicates as same Spanish term after normalization (trim spaces, lowercase, ignore accents, ignore punctuation like ¿ ? ! . ,).
- If duplicates exist, keep the best row using these rules:
    - Prefer rows with longer/more complete usage
    - Set known = TRUE if any duplicate has known = TRUE
    - Set learned to the sum of duplicates’ learned values

2. Remove very common words
Remove entries whose Spanish term (after normalization) matches any of these (including accentless versions):
hola, gracias, adios, por favor, buenos dias, buenas noches, lo siento, salud, de nada, si, no, amigo, amiga, familia, comida, agua, casa, escuela, trabajo, dinero, tiempo, día/dia, noche, hombre, mujer, niño, niña, perro, gato

3. Keep English translations in usage
- Do NOT remove parenthetical English translations from the usage field.

4. Add learning structure
Create these new columns:
- group (category) using keyword-based grouping based on spanish/english/usage (examples: Greetings & Politeness, Time & Dates, Work & Study, People & Family, Travel & Places, Feelings & Opinions, Goals & Motivation, General/Other)

- difficulty_score (number) using a transparent heuristic (longer phrases, more words, grammar connectors like que/de/por/para/aunque/porque, accents, punctuation like ¿¡ increase score)

- difficulty bucketed into Easy / Medium / Hard using score percentiles (bottom 33% Easy, middle 33% Medium, top 33% Hard)

-------------

Input: 

{{ JSON.stringify($json.output) }}

--------------

output:
[
    {
        "spanish": "",
        "english": "",
        "usage": "",
        "group": "",
        "difficulty_score": "",
        "difficulty": ""
    }
]

main.node: Append or update row in sheet
